data.text: When it comes to packing light and tight, flight attendants do know best. How to choose what to pack? And how to fit everything? Our cabin crew member shares her best tips for fitting it all into a carry-on: https://t.co/9XaCjjnzdu https://t.co/flT3kWRD3n

urls.title: Cabin crew tips: The art of packing
urls.description: When it comes to packing light and tight, flight attendants do know best. Cabin crew member Elina Poutanen has a set routine and shares her four tips for fitting it all into a carry-on. Even the most seasoned traveller stresses about what to pack in a carry-on bag. Cabin crew member Elina Poutanen shares four tried and true packing hacks for any trip. “I always start packing by checking the weather forecast. This way I have the right clothes and don’t pack any unnecessary items. I also like to think

urls.title: Sitting comfortably? Take a few minutes to read how seating on board works!
urls.description: We regularly get questions about how seats are assigned onboard and what are the best ways to ensure you get your desired seat. Read our Q & A on the topic and keep our tips in mind next time you book. When travelling in Economy or Premium Economy, you can choose a Standard seat from the selection that is still available at the time of check-in free of charge. However, if you want to make sure you get your preferred seat or that you are seated next to your travel companion, we recommend purchasing a seat

data.text: Do I need a visa for my destination? How should I enter my name when booking a plane ticket? What if my name is misspelt on my ticket? We listed the 10 most common questions and answers regarding travel documents: https://t.co/EMnYH7W9sm

urls.title: 10 questions about travel documents
urls.description: Do I need a visa for my destination? How do I enter my name when booking a flight ticket? Travel documents raise questions. Here come the ten most common questions and answers. When you buy a flight ticket from Finnair, we need your last name and at least one of your first names on the passport when making a reservation. For a smooth trip, it is even better if you enter all your first names stated in the passport, although this is not mandatory. Please make sure you enter all the names on the booking in

urls.title: Handling of delayed baggage heavily congested
urls.description: A large amount of baggage has been delayed due to congested baggage handling at many airports. We will deliver your baggage to you as soon as possible.  A large amount of baggage has been delayed due to congested baggage handling at many airports. Due to the circumstances and shortage of baggage handling staff the delivery of delayed baggage takes currently longer than normally and can take some days. At the moment the most problematic airports are Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Dallas, Edinburgh, Frankfurt,

data.text: Sitting comfortably in a cabin of its own between Business and Economy Class, our new Premium Economy cabin has cutting edge Nordic design at its heart. Read more about the benefits that our Premium Economy has to offer: https://t.co/znWYzMmd7X https://t.co/qbtKWgA49r

urls.title: Photo tour: Step inside Finnair’s new Premium Economy cabin
urls.description: Sitting comfortably in a cabin of its own between Business and Economy Class, our new Premium Economy cabin has cutting edge Nordic design at its heart. In Premium Economy, the seats offer 40% more space than in Economy Class, affording extra room to relax and enjoy the best that Finnair has to offer on a long haul trip to Asia or the United States. With a comfortable seat recline, a leg rest that supports the entire leg and memory foam cushions to ensure maximum comfort, it’s the perfect way to travel

data.text: @yourownkanoo We are not planning to cut wages and haven't said we are “hoping to outsource more jobs to third countries”. data.text: Finnair’s new Inflight Entertainment system (IFE) has won an international Red Dot Award 2022 in the Brand and Communication Design category. https://t.co/302NN8uRoI

urls.title: Finnair’s new Inflight Entertainment system wins Red Dot Award
urls.description: Finnair’s new Inflight Entertainment system (IFE) has won an international Red Dot Award 2022 in the Brand and Communication Design category. The Red Dot Design Award is one of the world’s leading design accolades, annually celebrating design and innovation and has become established internationally as one of the most sought-after marks of quality for good design. Harri Valkama, Finnair Digital Channel Lead for IFEC, said: “We are proud that Finnair’s in-house IFEC team was behind the design and developmen

data.text: In August, Finnair carried 880,500 passengers, which was 230.4% more than in August 2021. The number of passengers in August 2022 was 11.9% less than in July 2022. Read more: https://t.co/J5avj0B1LH https://t.co/JWA8RQV8H0

In Kittilä, you will spend unforgettable moments whether you wish to get away from the city bustle and relax in the wilderness or have an active holiday in the vicinity of the most beautiful nature spots. Read more: https://t.co/SzaXGqb5RV https://t.co/o9KBSnDAvg

urls.title: Kittilä – Get enchanted in the middle of Lapland's most wonderful landscapes
urls.description: In Kittilä, you'll find arctic nature, outstanding fells and the freshest air in the world. Head to Pallas-Yllästunturi National Park to experience the magic of Lapland wilderness or spend your holiday with different kinds of activities at the Levi Ski Resort. In Kittilä, you will spend unforgettable moments whether you wish to get away from the city bustle and relax in the wilderness or have an active holiday in the vicinity of the most beautiful nature spots. Less than 15 kilometres north of Kittilä

data.text: During the pandemic we’ve issued a lot of flight gift cards that expire on August 31st. urls.title: Finnair flight gift card

data.text: We have updated our traffic plan for the winter, as our operating environment has changed drastically. We’ll fly to over 60 short-haul and to 16 long-haul destinations. The traffic plan update includes some flight cancellations and schedule changes: https://t.co/AAfKK1yJ4v https://t.co/PIEHavit3q

urls.title: Changes in our traffic plan for winter 2022-2023
urls.description: Finnair has updated its traffic plan for winter 2022-2023. See the instructions here if your travel plans are affected due to changes. Finnair has adjusted its traffic plan for winter 2022–2023, as our operating environment has changed drastically during this year with the war in Ukraine and the subsequent closure of Russian airspace. Our aim is to operate a traffic plan that is as economically viable as possible. The traffic plan update includes flight cancellations and schedule changes. We are sorry

Finnair and Qatar Airways have concluded an agreement to establish a long-term strategic cooperation between Helsinki, Stockholm and Copenhagen and Doha. 
https://t.co/AUOmhDKMjB https://t.co/PzzK6GjpRX
@Shivani70123110 Hi, could you please DM us your booking reference so we can try to investigate this further? Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

@alanjfowler Alan, I apologize for the inconvenience caused by the changes to your original flights and our highest priority is the safe operation of the flights. We will contact you via direct message for more details

data.text: @davelugs Hi David, we offer 3 different ticket types that are explained on this page: https://t.co/jjMJSjto1I. Our Classic and Flex tickets include baggage. Meals are always included on our long-haul flights, you can read more here: https://t.co/3amrN3N8Cm. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

urls.title: Finnair ticket types
urls.description: Our ticket options available in Business, Premium Economy and Economy Class offer you the choice and flexibility you've been looking for.

urls.title: Long-haul meals
urls.description: With our tasty gourmet meals and complimentary beverages, dining in Business Class and Economy Class on long-haul flights offers a unique experience.

data.text: @Manikar9569 Hi, if you only transit via one Schengen country and your destination is outside the Schengen area, you don’t enter the Schengen area, and a visa is not required. Please read more here: https://t.co/wrQDsduMzR. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

data.text: @Shivani70123110 Hi, I'm sincerely sorry for the inconvenience! Airports around the world are really congested right now, and unfortunately, some bags are delayed. We are doing our best to deliver them as soon as possible. Please find some instructions here: https://t.co/olwJyNl1Qk. -Ada/Finnair

urls.title: Handling of delayed baggage heavily congested
urls.description: A large amount of baggage has been delayed due to congested baggage handling at many airports. We will deliver your baggage to you as soon as possible.  A large amount of baggage has been delayed due to congested baggage handling at many airports. Due to the circumstances and shortage of baggage handling staff the delivery of delayed baggage takes currently longer than normally and can take some days. At the moment the most problematic airports are Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Dallas, Edinburgh, Frankfurt,

data.text: @pedropescador @CSMIA_Official @HelsinkiAirport Hi, welcome onboard Finnair! I apologise for the technical problems. Could you kindly contact our customer service via the chatbot on our website or by calling them, and they'll be able to help you out: https://t.co/cDvIoqH6A6. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

Getting ready to fly with us? Please check in in advance via our mobile app or online on https://t.co/WWKAxOF6dL and arrive at the airport early. Check all our tips for smooth travels: https://t.co/9BZEPE2Rzf https://t.co/jfDxDTO6hm

urls.title: Tips for travelling during the summer season and peak hours
urls.description: We collected tips for you for smooth travelling during the busy summer season. During the peak hours and busier times, the number of customers at the airports and on our flights increases. Busy times are expected from time to time, and various service points as well as security checks may be congested. Also, this summer quickly increased travel and global labour shortages of airport operators and ground service providers, are causing congestion at many European airports. Below you’ll find some tips on

data.text: @EshaSareen1 @FinnairHelps @FinnairCargo Hi, I hope you will be able to locate your lost bag! Please find some information on this page https://t.co/Qrn7aBwpg5 regarding lost items. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

urls.title: Who do I contact if I have lost property at an airport or on board a Finnair flight?
urls.description: The item will be handed over to Suomen Löytötavarapalvelu (Lo st and Found service). Please visit their website for contact information. Please note that if the lost item is a passport, it will be given to Finnish Border Control. Tobacco products, alcohol, and other duty-free items left on the aircraft are given to Helsinki Airport Customs Passenger Control. Please contact them via phone at +358 9 6141. Please contact the local airport’s lost and found office. Depending on the item and who finds it

data.text: @JoakimInnila Kiitos, että valitsit meidät! Tervetuloa kyytiimme pian uudestaan! 😊✈️ -Ada/Finnair

@KalaApoorv Hi, I'm sorry to hear that our service didn't meet your expectations this time! If you would like, you may submit your feedback to us on this page: https://t.co/QnwlxpQKFS. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair

urls.title: Feedback and compensation
urls.description: We are currently experiencing backlog in our customer service. We are sorry for the delay in replying to your feedback. Thank you for your patience! We appreciate your feedback and are here to assist you with your claims and other concerns. Your feedback is valuable to us in developing our services further. For more general topics, please check our frequently asked questions, or get assistance from our chat service at any

data.text:
@BoruiF @BoruiF, thank you for your feedback! We apologize for the delay in replies via email, we are hindered from the volumes we received from delayed bags as a result of the congestion of the airports. 
We sent you a pm with some additional information requested. 
KR,
Finnair Team

@BoruiF Dear Borui, thank you for contacting Finnair. 
We are deeply sorry you have not been happy with our service this time. We strive to improve continuously. Airport congestions have been heavy lately. We have sent additional information for getting help. 
KR,
Finnair Team

urls.title: Pets on Finnair flights
urls.description: Information about transporting pets on Finnair flights.

data.text: @TGCOutcast @MalaysiaSunny Hi! You can let us know about your pet by contacting us via our chat service. Normally we can accept two pets in the cabin and two in the hold for one flight. However, the aircraft type, whether in the destination or allergic passengers on the flight may limit the number of pets.

data.text: Our home hub @HelsinkiAirport now provides you smoother travel experience than ever. For example, electronics and bags containing liquids can be left in hand baggage during security check. Read more about their renewed security check process: https://t.co/7tg22Khj2Q https://t.co/5yzGC2A7KM

urls.title: Helsinki Airport travel experience will be completely renewed in the spring and summer | Finavia
urls.description: The airport company Finavia will introduce next generation technology at Helsinki Airport to make security control quicker and easier. All flights will be centralised in one terminal, and the current Terminals 1 and 2 will become a thing of the past.

data.text: @tristanjbarber For a more complex booking please contact our customer service via chat or phone. Please find the contact info here https://t.co/cDvIoqpvIy Kind regards, Marika/Finnair 2/2

@tristanjbarber Hi Tristan, Did you know that “Multi-city” option in our booking engine allows you to book a round trip for different routes in each direction? You can find more info here: https://t.co/YGhWD5BrQc 1/2

urls.title: What is a multi-city booking?
urls.description: By selecting “Multi-city” as the trip type, you can book a round trip for different routes in each direction. For example, you can fly from Helsinki to Rome and return from Paris to Helsinki, the travel between Rome and Paris being arranged on your own by other means. You must return from the same continent you flew to and to the same continent you left from. For example, you can fly from E urope to Asia and back from Asia to Europe but not from Europe to Asia and then from Asia to North America. When

data.text: Pure nature, cleanest air in the world, wonderful natural phenomena, the world’s happiest people – Finland has it all! There are at least hundreds of reasons to travel to Finland. Find out what our top 10 are: https://t.co/10IR8Suasg https://t.co/57IltLaRQa

urls.title: Our top 10 reasons to visit Finland
urls.description: Welcome to Finland, the happiest country in the world! Pure nature, wonderful natural phenomena, cleanest air in the world – Finland has it all. Be sure to include a Finnish sauna, delicious local cuisine and a visit to Santa Claus Village on your bucket list. As Finland has four beautiful, distinct seasons, each with unique things to experience, you might want to plan more than one trip to Finland. There are at least hundreds of reasons to travel to Finland. We introduce 10 of them. Finland has four

data.text:
Our beautiful bird OH-LWI was getting scheduled maintenance at our home hub @HelsinkiAirport this week before flying to Delhi. ✈️ She has quite a busy schedule as she is flying 2-3 flights in just one day.

📷: Heikki Kotiranta, Lead Engineer at Finnair Technical Services https://t.co/e2SEKTCOQc

@Borasrinivasar5 @CSMIA_Official @HelsinkiAirport Hi, we are currently not planning a direct flight to Belgrade. However, we do offer flights there with our partners, you can check the schedules here: https://t.co/FE22wx9zBM. Kind regards, Ada/Finnair
